Name.BusinessNameLine1: SAN ANTONIO LIGHTHOUSE FOR THE BLIND

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: SAN ANTONIO LIGHTHOUSE (THE LIGHTHOUSE) IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION WHICH PROVIDES VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION AND EMPLOYMENT THROUGH THE INDUSTRIAL DIVISION FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE LEGALLY OR TOTALLY BLIND.
IRS990.MissionDescription: SAN ANTONIO LIGHTHOUSE (THE LIGHTHOUSE) IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION WHICH PROVIDES VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION AND EMPLOYMENT THROUGH THE INDUSTRIAL DIVISION FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE LEGALLY OR TOTALLY BLIND.
IRS990.Description: THE LIGHTHOUSE'S INDUSTRIAL DIVISION PROVIDED EMPLOYMENT FOR BLIND & MULTI-HANDICAPPED PERSONS IN THE ASSEMBLING OF PRODUCTS.

Activity2.Description: THE LIGHTHOUSE'S REHABILITATION SERVICES DIVISION PROVIDED EVALUATION AND TRAINING FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF JOB SKILLS, INCLUDING ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY TO ENABLE THE BLIND & MULTI- HANDICAPPED TO OBTAIN EMPLOYMENT.

Activity3.Description: THE LIGHTHOUSE'S BASE SERVICE STORES PROVIDED EMPLOYMENT FOR BLIND AND MULTI-HANDICAPPED PERSONS WHILE ALSO PROVIDING A MARKET FOR LIGHTHOUSE PRODUCTS.

ActivityOther.Description: THE LIGHTHOUSE SCHOLARSHIP FUND PROVIDES COLLEGE TUITION TO QUALIFIED BLIND AND MULTI-HANDICAPPED PERSONS SELECTED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. TUITION WAS PROVIDED FOR 10 PERSONS THIS YEAR.

NameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: GAYE PRESTON CPA CFO VP OF FINANCE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ENDOWMENT FUND WAS ESTABLISHED FOR THE REHABILITATION OF THE VISUALLY IMPAIRED.
ADJUSTMENT FOR COST OF GOODS SOLD LABOR: 5135133.
ADJUSTMENT FOR COST OF GOODS SOLD LABOR: 5135133.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: SAN ANTONIO LIGHTHOUSE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO MEET THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS: 1)MUST RESIDE IN SAN ANTONIO OR SURROUNDING REGION, 2)MUST ATTEND A SCHOOL WITHIN THE STATE OF TEXAS, 3)MUST BE LEGALLY BLIND PER STANDARDS OF THE COMMISSION FOR THE BLIND, AND 4)MUST MAINTAIN PASSING GRADES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FORM 990 INITIALLY AND THEN SUBMITS TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR THEIR FINAL REVIEW AND APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EVERY POTENTIAL BOARD MEMBER IS SCREENED FOR A POTENTIAL EXISTENCE OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THEN, ALL BOARD MEMBERS SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CEO'S SALARY IS REVIEWED BY AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND ALL INCREASES ARE ULTIMATELY APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE SALARY IS TIED TO THE ATTAINMENT OF IDENTIFIABLE GOALS AND COMPARED TO COMPARABLE POSITIONS IN THE INDUSTRY. THE CEO'S SALARY WAS REVIEWED IN MARCH 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE ON WWW.ORGANIZATION.ORG.
THE AUDIT COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.
